SENT.plain: A 62-year-old man was found to have myelodysplastic syndrome (MDS) and gastric cancer
Serum studies revealed hypogammaglobulinemia, and positive reactions to rheumatoid test and anti-nuclear antibody
Chromosomal analysis of the bone marrow revealed deletions of No. 5 and 7 chromosomes and that of the stomach showed complex abnormalities
It may be hypothesized that an initial event which selects a clone of stem cells could manifest with this sort of immunological abnormalities
Subsequent deranged immunosurveillance may be responsible for the increased risk of cancer
Alternatively an increased chromosomal instability which seems to be associated with immunodeficiencies might be responsible for cancer development
